ts_semantic_feature_detector.visualization package

Submodules

ts_semantic_feature_detector.visualization.colors module

Implements basic color returns for clustering.

ts_semantic_feature_detector.visualization.colors.get_color_from_cluster(cluster)[source]

Returns a string containing a different color for each cluster number.

Colors are returned in hexadecimal format.

ts_semantic_feature_detector.visualization.visualizer_2d module

Implements 2D visualizations using Matplotlib library.

class ts_semantic_feature_detector.visualization.visualizer_2d.Visualizer2D[source]

Bases: object

Abstracts specific visualizations using Matplolib library.

plot_mask_group(mask_group: MaskGroup, rgb_img: Image | _SupportsArray[dtype] | _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype]] | bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes | _NestedSequence[bool | int | float | complex | str | bytes] | None = None, subplot_shape: Tuple[int, int] | None = None, opt_avg_curve: str | None = None, opt_ransac_line: str | None = None, alpha: float = 1.0) → None[source]

Plot the group of masks.

The masks can be showed separately or together.

#TODO: check if the subplot_shape is compatible with the

number of masks.

Parameters:

  • mask_group (features2d.masks.MaskGroup) – the mask group.

  • rgb_img (PIL.Image) – the RGB image. If it is not informed, then the masks are plotted with no RGB image in the back.

  • subplot_shape (a tuple of [int, int], optional) – mask distribution in the figure. If it is not informed, the masks are showed in the same figure.

  • opt_avg_curve (str, optional) – the Matplotlib color and line options for the average curve (see matplotlib.pyplot.plot documentation for more details). If not specified, the curve will be omitted.

  • opt_ransac_line (str, optional) – the Matplotlib color and line options for the RANSAC line (see matplotlib.pyplot.plot documentation for more details). If not specified, the line will be omitted.

  • alpha (float, optional) – the mask transparency amount.

show(show_maximized: bool = False) → None[source]

Shows the previously configured plots.

Parameters:

show_maximized (bool, optional) – indicates if the plot will be showed with a maximized window.
